### Installation, Removal and Retrofit of Emergency and Safety Equipment in Police Vehicles

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking a contractor to provide labor, materials, storage, and retrieval services for the installation, removal, and retrofit of emergency and safety equipment in police vehicles. The contracted work will cover various vehicle platforms and equipment on an as-needed basis.

### Important Details

*   **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP) under Canada's Supply and Services Procurement Services (SPS) process
*   **Procurement Category:** Service (SRV)
*   **Trade Agreements:** This procurement is subject to various free trade agreements, including Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), and Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   **Regions of Opportunity and Delivery:** World, with a specific focus on Alberta, Canada
*   **Contracting Entity:** Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) Post Garage
*   **Expected Contract Start and End Dates:** None provided
*   **Security:** The procurement involves a security requirement

### Selection Criteria and Process

*   Bidders must comply with all bid solicitation requirements and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive.
*   All responsive bids will be ranked from lowest to highest price, with the top two lowest-priced bids recommended for contract award.
*   A minimum of one (1) contract to a maximum of two (2) may result from the solicitation process.

### Tender Submission

*   Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit as per page one of the Request for Proposal (RFP).
*   Refer to the attached tender documents for further information.

### Important Notes

*   Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.
*   The procurement is subject to the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada.
*   The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for all levels of government and the private sector to identify Indigenous business capacity.
*   For more information and to review eligibility
